metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3247 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.29, 8.1.* before 8.1.20, 8.2.* before 8.2.7 when using SOAP HTTP Digest Authentication, random value generator was not checked for failure, and was using narrower range of values than it should have. In case of random generator failure, it could lead to a disclosure of 31 bits of uninitialized memory from the client to the server, and it also made easier to a malicious server to guess the client's nonce.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.2 - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
libphp8.2-embed - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2 - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-bcmath - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-bz2 - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-cgi - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-cli - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-common - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-curl - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-dba - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-enchant - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-fpm - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-gd - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-gmp - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-imap - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-interbase - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-intl - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-ldap - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-mbstring - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-mysql - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-odbc - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-opcache - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-pgsql - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-phpdbg - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-pspell - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-readline - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
php8.2-snmp - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1

php8.2-xml - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1

php8.2-zip - 8.2.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial rodrigo-zaiden> the method php_random_bytes_throw that is being used for nonce generation was added in php7.0 with CSPRNG API, so patching versions older than that is not feasible as it would would likely add other issues.

criterions.comment: php8.2 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.2.7-1ubuntu1').
